pokemon:
Board: 3 Metal Blocks in 4th Row,
           3 Mincinno
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 5 Mincinno every 3 turns
srankingStrategy:
Dont try removing anything in the 4th
row. It will eventually fall and match 
the Mincinnos. Best bet is match 
Super Effectives or combos here
notes:
Moves: At least 2 moves left

Very easy with Super Effectives

If it is too much, Move+5 will do this

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Barriers every 3 turns
srankingStrategy:
Our very first Ice Pokemon. Not that
hard though
notes:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
If it is too much, Super Effective from
later Pokemons will do

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 3 Chatot
Timer: None
srankingStrategy:
Only one disruption. After that feel free
to do anything
notes:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
If it is too much, Super Effective from
later Pokemons will do

pokemon:
Board: 4 Axew on the Board
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Rocks every 3 turns
srankingStrategy:
The only way to remove the Axew
(except for adding Axew with you) is
to match all 4. Do so and continue
matching. Its not that hard
notes:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Axew is Super Effective here and bringing
it can easily do this

pokemon:
Board: Last 2 rows are Metal Blocks
Initial: None
Timer: None

Notes: Adds a number of Zorua if the
          dropped Pokemon doesn't make a
          4+ line

After Notes x3: After Adds 2 row of Metal
                       Blocks after rows.
                       Repeat to Notes.
srankingStrategy:
Do not use Kangaskhan here. Audino
is good at clearing the blocks
notes:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
If it is too much, Super Effective from
later Pokemons will do

pokemon:
Board: 8 Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: None
srankingStrategy:
Move C3 to D4 and it will trigger
clearing the stage and the blocks
notes:
Moves: At least 2 move left
Clearing Strategy will S-Rank it

          Adds a Wartortle after 2 turns.

pokemon:
Board: 6 Rocks and 3 Hawlucha
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Hawlucha every 2 turns.
notes:
Moves: At least 3 moves left
Adding Hawlucha will make this stage
easier. Move+5 can also be used for
easy S-Rank

pokemon:
Board: Rocks at Center and Sides
Initial: None
Timer: None
srankingStrategy: Swap B2 and D5 to get this clear
notes:
Moves: At least 2 moves left
Clearing Strategy seems to do it

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 5 Rocks every 3 turns

Half Turn: Adds 4 Metal Blocks every 2
               turns
srankingStrategy:
Hawlucha's Rock Break will be useful
in this stage. Make sure to get rid of 
Rocks before the Mega Blocks appear.
Kangaskhan's Mega Effect will clear
out Mega Blocks if needed
(Although Audino will also do)
notes:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Doable itemless with M-Luke team

Move+5 will do this. Or you can do it later
when you get more Fighting Types
(Hint: Lucario)
